page.title: 14BRIERLEY HILL GLASS CO. 02
page.content: The Brierley Glass Company buys blank glasses from Germany because of the quality and colour the glass has. They order the blanks according to size, shape and thickness. The thickest piece of glass you can get is 1 inch or 2.5 cm thick. If you are going to cut elaborate designs you will need thicker glass. Terry draws all the designs on paper and following this, guide lines are painted on the glass and then the designs can be cut. The carborundum stone has to be dressed every so often using old pieces of broken stones. The carborundum stone is used to make the rough cuts then a finer one for smoothing it off. Finally the glass is dipped into acid to give it its' sparkle.
